Pre-Game Insights: David Peterson has been good all season, especially in August, throwing 31.2 innings this month, allowing just 23 hits, one homerun, and a 1.71 ERA.
Peterson has led the Mets to four straight wins in games he has started.

The Diamondbacks need Ryne Nelson to have one of his good starts in this game, as he has been very good since the beginning of July, with a 2.62 ERA in 62 innings pitched, 62 strikeouts, and just 47 hits allowed.
The Diamondbacks are 8-2 in Nelson's 10 starts since the beginning of July.
The Diamondbacks hit a lot of ground balls, but they are still second in the MLB in batting average and fifth in slugging percentage.
Peterson allows opposing hitters to make solid contact a lot, so the Diamondbacks should be able to take advantage of that.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This game is a pitching matchup between David Peterson and Ryne Nelson, with both pitchers throwing the ball really well lately.
The under may hit Thursday night due to the strong pitching performance of both teams.
The moneyline will be the pick Thursday night, with the Mets ML (-102) as the recommended choice.
